intro: Bilacunaria caspica, commonly known as the Caspian bilacunaria, is a rare flowering plant native to the Caspian Sea region. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and thrives in moist, sandy soils. It is often found in coastal dunes and saline environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
